triples.name: Integer programming
triples.relevance: Foundation for constraint integer programming (CIP) framework at the heart of SCIP.

triples.name: Branch and bound
triples.relevance: Core algorithm used by SCIP for solving optimization problems via systematic tree search.

triples.name: Cutting-plane method
triples.relevance: Key algorithmic approach used by SCIP to tighten linear programming relaxations.

triples.name: Heuristic (computer science)
triples.relevance: Basis for primal heuristics implemented in SCIP to find feasible solutions quickly.

triples.name: Linear programming
triples.relevance: Underlying optimization framework used by SoPlex LP solver integrated with SCIP.

triples.name: Mathematical optimization
triples.relevance: Overarching field encompassing all optimization techniques employed in the SCIP suite.

triples.name: Nonlinear programming
triples.relevance: New nonlinear handlers in SCIP 9.0 extend capability to handle nonlinear constraints.

triples.name: Constraint programming
triples.relevance: Related paradigm that influences constraint handling and symmetry recognition in SCIP.
